DOC.brief_summary: This study aim observe whether hydrolyzed oyster extract improve liver health participant whose alanine transaminase ( ALT ) level are1-3 fold normal . A total 96 participant randomly allocate active ( oyster ) placebo group ( 1:1 ) . Each group receive 750 mg oyster extract placebo per day 8 week . Primary outcome change ALT level secondary outcome ; ( 1 ) ratio participant normal ALT , aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) , gamma-glutamyl transferase ( GGT ) ; ( 2 ) change serum bilirubin ; ( 3 ) change multi-dimensional fatigue inventory ; ( 4 ) change serum lipid ; ( 5 ) change antioxidant enzyme .
DOC.criteria: Age 19 AST , ALT , GGT level upper limit normal less 3 time upper limit normal Participants normal physical activity sign inform consent form Fatty liver detect ultrasound Allergic reaction oyster Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus Active viral hepatitis liver disease affect trial outcome ( positive HBs Ag HCV Ab ) Liver cirrhosis ChildPugh class B C Chemotherapy radiation therapy cancer within 6 month Cholelithiasis Systemic medication affect liver function INH , valproic acid , tetracycline , allopurinol , phenytoin , phenelzine , sertraline , naproxen diclofenac within 4 week Medication cholagogues , cholelitholytics & hepatic protector , antidote , detoxify agent , drug abuse ( drug use substance dependence ) within 4 week Alcoholism excessive alcohol intake 168 g/week men 112 g/week woman Kidney diseases serum creatinine level 2.0 mg/dL Uncontrolled hypertension angina pectoris myocardiac infarction History bowel resection ( include surgery simple appendicitis ) Medication antipsychotic drug Herbal medication within 2 month Pregnancy breastfeed Participation clinical trial ( ) within 1 month screen day Uncooperativeness Intake dietary supplement within 4 week
